I was introduced to Yoga With Adriene last year by an acquaintance of mine who'd been in a very bad cycling accident months prior. In speaking with her during her recovery after the accident, it came out that she is very well-versed in Yoga and was actively using Yoga to help with her healing process. Having no experience with Yoga and out of curiosity, I asked her for a good Yoga resource and she recommended YWA. Initially, I was surprised by how many videos there are, each with a different focus in mind. On a separate note, at the end of 2018, I gave myself temporary Sciatica on my right side by lifting something incorrectly and that was far too heavy for me to be lifting. Through physical therapy (with, I'm certain, some Yoga positions involved) and strategic stretches (planks) on my own, though, I was able to eradicate the pain. In working through Adriene and Benji's videos, whatever accomplishments that I've made or haven't made, anger, unease, stress, fear, or worry that I may have, it all goes away for 20 or 30 minutes. It's incredible just how tense muscles/tendons/ligaments can get by just dealing with everyday life. After Yoga, though, I feel like a rubberband, I feel calm, and I feel like I've accomplished something! I remember getting so involved that, after watching the Yogi Tea video, I went out to the store at like 10pm and bought all of the ingredients (sadly, no fresh Cardamom seeds; only dried pods)! It doesn't matter if one is as skilled at the various Yoga positions as Adriene is; as long as you have the general idea of what the positions are trying to do, that's what matters. It's nice that Adriene understands that for everyone. Thank you, Adriene and Benji, for all of your videos and instruction. I'm excitedly looking forward to more Yoga!
